Params: {3: 'The students return to the academy scattered and straggling, dragging their broken bodies. The crowd is barely half as dense as when they departed.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Phantom images from your dreams still linger on your retinas.'}
{3: 'The morning sunlight fails to dispel the gloom brought by the nightmare. Jetavie—that girl—had vanished so easily in the dream.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Was it merely a nightmare, or something you truly experienced?'}
{3: 'The phantom images fade away, but the bell continues to ring.'}
{3: 'Quickly dressing and heading downstairs, the metallic, rusty smell of vital fluid floods your nostrils. Red liquid smears stretch from the stairs all the way down the corridor.'}
{3: "Students pass by, supporting one another, but you still can't find that distinctive black figure anywhere."}
{3: 'From a distance, you spot Martha and Ewig at the school entrance. As you pass through the crowd, you silently note the numbers on the collars around their necks: 8, 10, 13, 22, 24, 26...'}
{3: 'Non-sequential numbers, vastly different from the roster Martha announced before the battle...'}

{2: 'Ewig', 3: 'Communication towers in all sectors have been destroyed. Only Sector 7 retains an energy station and two computation nodes. The economic loss amounts to 1,382 standard supply units.', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Ewig', 3: 'Additionally, the walls of City 141 have sustained damage. The eastern wall is damaged, with a minor breach. If the Corrupted launch another assault targeting this breach, the city will come under attack.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Martha', 3: 'Have you determined why the Corrupted launched another attack so soon?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Martha', 3: 'What were the casualties among our humanoid combat units?', 4: '2'}
{3: 'She recites the numbers to Martha without expression, and Martha listens silently, standing ramrod straight.'}
{2: 'Ewig', 3: 'All company property losses have been fully accounted for.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'After hearing the report, Martha silently departs, brushing past a person who has pushed through the crowd to get here.'}
{2: 'What about Jetavie?', 3: '87', 4: 'Where is the highest value unit?', 5: '87'}
{1: '1', 3: 'She steps aside, revealing a black body bag.'}
{3: 'From the opening of the bag, a pair of familiar yet vacant eyes stare back.'}
{3: "Ewig pulls the bag open, revealing the young girl's shattered mechanical torso."}
{3: 'Her delicate bionic skin is torn in large patches, revealing her mechanical skeleton splintered to pieces... What kind of battle could have damaged her so severely?'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ewig', 3: "She's just out of power. She can still function.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ewig', 3: 'Her consciousness becomes unstable during extended battles. She kills enemies recklessly, causing extensive damage to her frame. This is the only way we can bring her back.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ewig', 3: "Hmm... yesterday's battle was an exception. She usually doesn't walk back on her own in such an intact state.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ewig', 3: "However, her target that day was No. 17's body. Perhaps she didn't fully engage in battle because you had already retrieved No. 17.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Ewig furrows her brow. She seems to be merely stating facts without understanding the cause behind the situation.'}
{2: 'No... she was there too. She helped me eliminate the Corrupted.', 3: '117'}
{2: 'Ewig', 3: "That doesn't fit her logic either. She usually doesn't follow the teacher's orders, much less fight alongside them.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ewig', 3: '...but perhaps some unforeseen factor has emerged.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'She falls silent in thought for a moment, ultimately unable to reach a logical conclusion.'}
{3: 'The morning course consists of some simple tactical coordination exercises.'}
{3: 'After evaluating materials left by previous tactical teachers, you devised what seemed like straightforward training protocols, but the actual implementation fell short of expectations.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ewig', 3: "...I'm sorry, Teacher. I just made a mistake with my commands.", 4: '1'}
{3: "After failing to exit the system again, Ewig's face turns pale."}
{3: 'Even though mechanoids possess data processing capabilities far superior to humans, they cannot think beyond the shackles of their programming.'}
{3: "Martha's requirements prevent you from actually commanding in battle, otherwise..."}
{3: 'One-third of the seats in the classroom are now empty.'}
{3: "Due to her severe injuries, Jetavie is not participating in today's class."}
{3: 'When the end-of-class bell rings, you bid farewell to the other students and head to the repair room, hoping to check on her.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Student 1', 3: "Hello, Teacher. Jetavie isn't here. At this hour, she's usually at the clock tower.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'You ascend the spiral staircase and find her at the top of the clock tower.'}
{3: "The girl looks slightly startled. She hasn't fully recovered, and she sits there trying to reattach her right arm to her shoulder."}
{3: 'An apology escapes your lips before you can think. Somehow, it feels impolite to see a mechanoid in the midst of repairs.'}
{3: 'A teasing laugh drifts from behind you.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Jetavie', 3: 'Did you sneak up here without a word just to see me in this miserable state?', 4: '18'}
{2: 'I just wanted to make sure you were out of danger.', 3: '188', 4: '...', 5: '186'}
{2: 'Jetavie', 3: 'Your silence is as good as admitting it.\\nEven if it risked finding me in pieces, you still came to check on me.', 4: '18'}
{2: 'Jetavie', 3: 'Well, well, I never knew you were a teacher who cares so much about your students... Hey, turn around.', 4: '18'}
{1: '1', 3: "With her permission, you turn around. A mysterious light flickers in the girl's eyes, making her thoughts impossible to read."}
{3: 'Much of her body is still exposed, with mechanical structures, cables, and connection ports clearly visible inside.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Even in this state, she looks much better than a few hours ago when she was just scattered pieces in a burlap sack.'}
{2: 'Jetavie', 3: 'So-so, I guess. At least I can move properly now.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Why did you push yourself so hard in battle?', 3: '218'}
{2: 'Jetavie', 3: "Hmph, if the neural interface in my leg hadn't broken, I could've brought back a few more...", 4: '1'}
{3: 'She focuses on connecting two cables as if discussing something trivial. Is she like those "weapons," with no regard for her own life?'}
{3: 'If that were truly the case, she would risk her life to protect more valuable assets, not other "weapons."'}
{2: "You risked everything for the others... but White tells me you've always been a lone wolf?", 3: '226'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Jetavie', 3: "Hah? What's the point of getting close to them?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Jetavie', 3: 'When we set out, the old hag must have warned you about some things, right?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Martha', 3: "A word of advice: don't get too emotionally attached to them. It's better for both you and them.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Jetavie', 3: "For weapons, the stronger they are, the more recklessly they'll throw themselves into battle. Unnecessary emotions only limit their strength.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Jetavie', 3: 'And for you humans... treating weapons who fight at dawn and die by dusk as people will only end up hurting yourselves.', 4: '1'}
{2: '...But they have their own emotions too.', 3: '250'}
{3: 'Showing empathy toward those who can feel is almost an instinct of human nature.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Jetavie', 3: 'Are you referring to White? The one who showed you around campus after I left.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'As if reading your thoughts, she suddenly mentions this name.'}
{2: 'Jetavie', 3: 'She was sacrificed in the battle just now.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'White', 3: '...! I like the word "story." Was White planning to become a novelist?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'White', 3: "Hmph! I'll definitely write a story that will have Teacher singing its praises.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Jetavie', 3: "I don't know. We weren't in the same combat zone, but her serial number appeared on the casualty list.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Her calm voice betrays a certain numbness.'}
{2: 'Jetavie', 3: 'She liked to stare at the sky, would enter "diary mode" whenever something interesting happened, and even wrote about things beyond reality...', 4: '1'}
{2: "You've noticed so many details... I thought you weren't close to them?", 3: '281'}
{2: 'Jetavie', 3: "Of course not. I only spoke with her a handful of times. After all, they'll all be used up sooner or later, so there's no point in investing too much emotion.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Jetavie', 3: "...But that doesn't stop me from remembering them.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Jetavie', 3: 'Of all the mechanoids here, endlessly caught in this cycle of war and reincarnation, I alone have survived.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Jetavie', 3: "If even I don't remember them... what happens when no one remembers these interesting things?", 4: '1'}
{3: 'After tightening the final connection port, she stands up and stretches with a long, lazy arch of her back.'}
{3: "Snow-white daylight pours into the room, bathing the young girl's figure in a dreamlike silver-gray hue."}
{3: 'With the same playful, enigmatic smile as when the two of you first met, she turns to look back at you.'}
{2: 'Jetavie', 3: "Commandant, after spending so much time here with me, you must have noticed by now, haven't you?"}
{3: 'Snow-white daylight, snow-white walls, snow-white ceiling and doorways—yet among all this, what stands out as incongruous is...'}
{3: 'In the center of the room hangs a mammoth black clock, far too large for comfort.'}
{2: 'Jetavie', 3: 'The clock in this tower is broken. Both the hour and minute hands rotate counterclockwise.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Jetavie', 3: 'Countdown... someone once told me that. If you add a possessive, it would be "countdown of life," wouldn\'t it?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Jetavie', 3: 'Life flows toward its end, yet the hands of the clock march ever onward to the next cycle, repeating a hopeless loop.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Her silhouette becomes ethereal and hazy in the sunlight.'}
{2: 'Jetavie', 3: 'Everything here, no matter how stable it may appear on the surface... is actually a fragile existence.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Against the light, her expression is impossible to make out.'}
{2: 'Jetavie', 3: 'Ah... what a shame, it seems I\'m also among the "fragile" ones.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'She leaps gracefully from on high, trailing a shower of sparks as she descends.'}
{2: 'Jetavie', 3: 'The last time... do you remember the last time? When we... "battled" together.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Her bright red pupils flash with evident interest.'}
{2: 'Jetavie', 3: 'I wonder why. When I fight alongside you, somehow I can stay sane...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'She narrows her eyes, gently pressing her oil-stained fingers against your neck.'}
{2: 'Jetavie', 3: 'Next time, how about you join me in battle?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: '???', 3: "Maybe next time, we'll run a bit faster, reach a bit farther.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'A hazy déjà vu shatters the space around them. Their minds struggle to anchor themselves in the present.'}
{2: "...but the company doesn't allow tactical teachers to command in the field.", 3: '404'}
{2: 'Jetavie', 3: "Just reach out your hand, and I promise I won't leave it hanging.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Despite the playful smile on her face, her eyes are intensely serious.'}
{3: 'Urgent, rapid bell tolls interrupt your conversation; the sound is deafening since you are at the top of the clock tower.'}
{3: 'The alarm warning of a Corrupted ambush rings out once again.'}
{2: '??', 3: "It's all done. This frequency will lure them toward the breach in the city wall.", 4: '2'}
{2: '???', 3: 'Excellent. Once the central district falls, control will be transferred to us.', 4: '1'}
{2: '???', 3: "Even if we don't fully succeed, they will still make excellent test subjects.", 4: '1'}
